statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Jordan Carter scored 11 points and George Mason limited North Carolina-Wilmington to just two first-half field goals -- matching the fewest in a half in the shot clock era -- in a 55-34 win over the Seahawks on Monday night.
article.headline: George Mason maintains early lead, defeats UNCW
article.linkText: Geo. Mason rolls, holds UNCW to two first-half field goals
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP) -- Jordan Carter scored 11 points and George Mason limited North Carolina-Wilmington to just two first-half field goals -- matching the fewest in a half in the shot clock era -- in a 55-34 win over the Seahawks on Monday night. The Patriots (7-7, 1-3 Colonial Athletic Association) used three new starters to hold the Seahawks (4-9, 0-4) to just 2-for-23 shooting and force 12 turnovers in the first half, when North Carolina-Wilmington scored a school-record low 10 points. Todd Henley's 12 points led the Seahawks, whose two field goals in the first half matched the fewest in a half since the 1985-86 season. Ohio also held Central Michigan to two field goals in a half on Jan. 14, 2006. The Seahawks went 17:41 without a field goal and missed 12 consecutive 3-pointers. Daniel Fountain ended the drought with a 3-pointer as time expired in the first half, cutting the Patriots' lead to 29-10. The second half was not much better for the Seahawks as they shot just 8 for 49 and went on to their sixth straight loss.
